# format_destination.format_destination { #travelpy.format_destination.format_destination }

```python
format_destination.format_destination(city, country_code)
```

Normalize destination names into the format: "City, COUNTRY_CODE".

Rules:
  - city and country_code must be non-empty strings after stripping
  - country_code must be exactly 2 alphabetic letters
  - city is title-cased; country_code is upper-cased

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name         | Type   | Description                                 | Default    |
|--------------|--------|---------------------------------------------|------------|
| city         | str    | City name (e.g., "vancouver").              | _required_ |
| country_code | str    | Two-letter country code (e.g., "ca", "FR"). | _required_ |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                         |
|--------|--------|-----------------------------------------------------|
|        | str    | Formatted destination string: "City, COUNTRY_CODE". |

## Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

| Name   | Type       | Description                                                     |
|--------|------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | ValueError | If inputs are empty after stripping or country_code is invalid. |
|        | TypeError  | If inputs are not strings.                                      |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> from dsci_524_group_25.format_destination import format_destination
>>> format_destination("vancouver", "ca")
'Vancouver, CA'
>>> format_destination("  paris ", " fr ")
'Paris, FR'
>>> format_destination("TOKYO", "jp")
'Tokyo, JP'
```
